title: 105_s673
content: The "ESOP Promotion Act of 1997" allows S Corporations to establish Employee Stock Ownership Plans. The ESOP Promotion Act of 1997 allows S Corporations to establish Employee Stock Ownership Plans. It repeals certain provisions related to ESOP benefits for S Corporations and allows ESOPs to distribute cash instead of stock. The Code of 1986 is amended to allow S corporations to maintain plans that do not require participants to exercise certain rights, as long as they provide the option to receive distributions in cash. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to provide exemptions from prohibited transaction rules for ESOPs and shareholder employees. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1997. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS RELATED TO SECTION 1042. Extension of Section 1042 Principles to Stock Received as Compensation for Services. This amendment excludes transfers of qualified securities sold to Employee Stock Ownership Plans from income inclusion within 60 days. The amendment allows for the exclusion of transfers of qualified securities sold to Employee Stock Ownership Plans from income inclusion within 60 days. It also specifies that the person for whom services were performed will not be entitled to a deduction with respect to such transfer. The amendment to section 1042 of the Code allows for the exclusion of transfers of qualified securities sold to Employee Stock Ownership Plans from income inclusion within 60 days. It also specifies that any recognized gain after the initial exclusion shall be treated as ordinary income. The amendment to section 1042 of the Code excludes qualified securities received in certain transfers from income inclusion. The basis of the taxpayer in qualified replacement property purchased during the replacement period is reduced by the amount of gain not recognized. If a taxpayer disposes of qualified replacement property, gain shall be recognized to the extent of the previously unrecognized gain. The amendments made by this subsection apply to sales of qualified securities on or after the enactment date. Section 409(n)(1)(B) of the Code is modified regarding the 25-percent shareholder rule. The amendment modifies section 409(n)(1)(B) of the Code to include shareholders who own more than 25% of the voting power or value of stock in a corporation. The effective date of this amendment is the date of the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. ESOP dividends can be reinvested without losing the dividend deduction. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 1997.
